availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas McKinster (Lawrence County, KY farmer and soldier)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Delila McKinster. Father of Elizabeth McKinster, Sarah Ann McKinster, W. Harrison C. McKinster, Louisa McKinster, and Louisiana McKinster. Married to Mary Jane Pack McKinster. Father of William Farris McKinster, Flavius Joseph McKinster, Martha B. McKinster, and Martin B. McKinster. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1850. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from December 10, 1861 to June 8, 1862. Served in the 68th Regiment of Kentucky Enrolled Militia as colonel from May 21, 1864 to June 22, 1864.
